page.title: 20TOURISM IN DALRY(KIRK)
page.content: Many tourists pass through this scenic area in summer and stop to admire the attractive houses and gardens.In winter increasing numbers of bird watchers are coming. Most are from the north of England but the area is also popular with German and Scandinavian visitors. Tourists from Australasia and the Americas often come to visit relatives or to trace ancestors. The opening of the Southern Upland Way, which passes through Dalry,has resulted in increasing numbers of walkers seeking provisions and overnight accomodation. There is an hotel,an inn and a cafe in Dalry and several houses provide excellent bed and breakfast at reasonable cost.
